title: 3 Easy Ways to Add Money to PayPal + Troubleshooting

steps.title: Open the PayPal app.
steps.content: Open the PayPal app. If you aren't already logged into your PayPal account, enter your email address or phone number and password to do so now. You must have a verified PayPal Balance account with a confirmed identity to send money from your bank to your PayPal account. If you haven't confirmed, you won't see this option. In the past, PayPal Balance was PayPal Cash and PayPal Cash Plus. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Add a bank.
steps.content: Add a bank. If you haven't already added your bank or debit/credit card, you must do so before you can transfer funds to your PayPal account. Do the following: Tap Accounts at the bottom. Tap Add banks and cards . Select Banks , Debit and credits cards , or Amex Send Account . Enter your information. Verify if necessary. Tap Home to return to the PayPal homepage.

steps.title: Tap Add Money.
steps.content: Tap Add Money . You can find this next to your balance on the home page. If you don't see this, tap Accounts , and then Balance .

steps.title: Select From your bank or debit card.
steps.content: Select From your bank or debit card . A new menu will open.

steps.title: Enter the amount you want to transfer.
steps.content: Enter the amount you want to transfer. If you're transferring from a debit card, you can only transfer up to $5,000 a day, $10,000 per week, and $20,000 per month. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap In seconds with debit or In 3-5 days with your bank.
steps.content: Tap In seconds with debit or In 3-5 days with your bank . This will send your transfer request. Once approved, you'll see the funds in your PayPal balance.

steps.title: Open the PayPal website.
steps.content: Open the PayPal website . If you aren't already logged into your PayPal account, enter your email address or phone number and password to do so now. You must have a verified PayPal Balance account with a confirmed identity to send money from your bank to your PayPal account. If you haven't confirmed, you won't see this option. In the past, PayPal Balance was PayPal Cash and PayPal Cash Plus.

steps.title: Add a bank.
steps.content: Add a bank. If you haven't already added your bank or debit/credit card, you must do so before you can transfer funds to your PayPal account. Do the following: Click Wallet at the top. Click Link a card or bank . Select Link a debit or credit card , Link a bank account , or Amex Send Account . Enter your information. Verify if necessary. Click Home to return to the PayPal homepage.

steps.title: Click Wallet at the top.
steps.content: Click Wallet at the top. This is between Rewards and Activity .

steps.title: Click Transfer Money.
steps.content: Click Transfer Money . You can find this next to your balance on the home page.

steps.title: Select Add money from your bank or debit card.
steps.content: Select Add money from your bank or debit card . A new menu will open.

steps.title: Enter the amount you want to transfer.
steps.content: Enter the amount you want to transfer. If you're transferring from a debit card, you can only transfer up to $5,000 a day, $10,000 per week, and $20,000 per month.

steps.title: Click In seconds with debit or In 3-5 days with your bank.
steps.content: Click In seconds with debit or In 3-5 days with your bank . This will send your transfer request. You'll receive your funds immediately or in a few days depending on your transfer method.

steps.title: Open the PayPal app.
steps.content: Open the PayPal app. If you aren't already logged into your PayPal account, enter your email address or phone number and password to do so now. You must have a verified PayPal Balance account with a confirmed identity to send money from your bank to your PayPal account. If you haven't confirmed, you won't see this option. Cash a Check allows you to deposit checks remotely on your mobile device. This will add the funds directly to your PayPal Balance account. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Accounts.
steps.content: Tap Accounts . You can find this at the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Tap Balance.
steps.content: Tap Balance . A new page will open.

steps.title: Tap Cash a check.
steps.content: Tap Cash a check . If you don't see this option, your PayPal Balance account is not verified or updated.

steps.title: Input your check details and tap Next.
steps.content: Input your check details and tap Next . Enter the check amount into the field. Then, take a picture of the front and back of the check. Make sure the picture is clear with good lighting.

steps.title: Select the transfer method, and then tap Confirm.
steps.content: Select the transfer method, and then tap Confirm . Typically, it takes a few seconds for a check to clear, though it can take up to a few minutes. In rare cases, it may take an hour to verify and clear your check.

steps.title: Void the check.
steps.content: Void the check. Once your check is approved, you'll be directed to write VOID across the front of your check and send a picture as proof. Once the picture is approved, you'll see a confirmation page along with when you'll see your funds in your PayPal balance.

steps.title: Verify your PayPal account.
steps.content: Verify your PayPal account. If you don't see the option to add funds from your bank, make sure your account is fully verified. You can check by navigating to your profile and checking for any prompts.

steps.title: Sign up for the PayPal debit card.
steps.content: Sign up for the PayPal debit card. If you still don't see the option to add funds, you may have a regular PayPal account rather than a PayPal Balance account. To quickly upgrade your account, you must sign up for the PayPal debit card . [4] X Research source If your account was verified before March 29, 2020, and/or you have a PayPal Cash card, your account was automatically converted to PayPal Cash (now PayPal Balance). You will see a balance and can deposit checks to your PayPal account. If you created your personal account after that date and/or don't see a PayPal Balance section, you don't have PayPal Cash/PayPal Balance. You can still link a bank account, credit, or debit card and send/receive payments, but you can't add money to your PayPal account to store it there.

steps.title: Use an alternative.
steps.content: Use an alternative. If you don't have the PayPal debit card and want to be able to keep money in your PayPal account, you can ask someone to send money to your PayPal account instead. Then, tap the transaction in PayPal and select Keep it in PayPal . Follow the on-screen instructions to enter your personal information so you can add money.
